section_id: ## Appendix B: Effective Spatial Dynamics via Kramers-Smoluchowski Reduction

hints.label: thm-kramers-smoluchowski-standard
hints.title: Effective Spatial SDE in High-Friction Limit
hints.content:
1011: :label: thm-kramers-smoluchowski-standard
1012: 
1013: Consider the Stratonovich Langevin system:
1014: 
1015: $$
1016: \begin{aligned}
1017: dx &= v \, dt \\
1018: dv &= [-\nabla U_{\text{eff}}(x) - \gamma v] dt + \sqrt{2\gamma T} \, g(x)^{-1/2} \circ dW
1019: \end{aligned}
1020: $$
1021: 
1022: In the high-friction limit $\gamma \gg 1$, the effective spatial dynamics is governed by the **Stratonovich SDE**:
1023: 
1024: $$
1025: dx = -\frac{1}{\gamma} \nabla U_{\text{eff}} \, dt + \sqrt{\frac{2T}{\gamma}} g(x)^{-1/2} \circ dW + O(\gamma^{-2})
1026: $$
1027: 
1028: The spatial marginal density $\rho_s(x, t) := \int \rho(x, v, t) dv$ satisfies the **spatial Fokker-Planck equation**:
1029: 
1030: $$
1031: \frac{\partial \rho_s}{\partial t} = \nabla \cdot \left[\frac{T}{\gamma} g(x)^{-1} \nabla \rho_s + \frac{1}{\gamma} \rho_s \nabla U_{\text{eff}}\right] + O(\gamma^{-2})
1032: $$

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-28
hints.content:
1036: 
1037: :::{prf:proof}
1038: This is a **standard result** from the theory of multiscale stochastic dynamics. The proof uses the Chapman-Enskog expansion method to average over fast velocity degrees of freedom in the high-friction regime.
1039: 
1040: **Reference:** Pavliotis, G.A. (2014), *Stochastic Processes and Applications: Diffusion Processes, the Fokker-Planck and Langevin Equations*, Springer, **Theorem 7.6.1** (pp. 231-235).
1041: 
1042: **Outline of the standard proof:**
1043: 
1044: 1. **Timescale separation**: In the limit $\gamma \gg 1$, velocities equilibrate on timescale $\tau_v \sim O(\gamma^{-1})$ while spatial diffusion occurs on timescale $\tau_x \sim O(\gamma)$.
1045: 
1046: 2. **Chapman-Enskog expansion**: The phase-space distribution is expanded as $\rho(x, v, t) = \rho_s(x, t) M_x(v) [1 + O(\gamma^{-1})]$ where $M_x(v)$ is the local velocity equilibrium with covariance determined by $g(x)$.
1047: 
1048: 3. **Effective spatial FPE**: Integrating the phase-space Fokker-Planck equation over velocities and using the expansion yields the stated spatial FPE.
1049: 
1050: 4. **Stratonovich preservation**: The key observation is that the **Wong-Zakai correction term** $(T/(2\gamma)) g^{-1} \nabla \log \det g$ appears in the effective drift, which is the signature of Stratonovich calculus. This term arises from the position-dependence of the diffusion matrix $D(x) = (T/\gamma) g(x)^{-1}$.

hints.label: prop-spatial-sde-stationary
hints.title: Stationary Distribution of Effective Spatial SDE
hints.content:
1056: :label: prop-spatial-sde-stationary
1057: 
1058: The stationary distribution of the effective spatial SDE (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-kramers-smoluchowski-standard`) is:
1059: 
1060: $$
1061: \rho_{\text{st}}(x) = \frac{1}{Z} \sqrt{\det g(x)} \exp\left(-\frac{U_{\text{eff}}(x)}{T}\right)
1062: $$
hints.section: ## Appendix B: Effective Spatial Dynamics via Kramers-Smoluchowski Reduction
hints.raw_directive:
1053: :::
1054: 
1055: :::{prf:proposition} Stationary Distribution of Effective Spatial SDE
1056: :label: prop-spatial-sde-stationary
1057: 
1058: The stationary distribution of the effective spatial SDE (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-kramers-smoluchowski-standard`) is:
1059: 
1060: $$
1061: \rho_{\text{st}}(x) = \frac{1}{Z} \sqrt{\det g(x)} \exp\left(-\frac{U_{\text{eff}}(x)}{T}\right)
1062: $$
1063:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-58
hints.content:
1066: 
1067: :::{prf:proof}
1068: **Direct verification via zero-flux condition:**
1069: 
1070: The stationary distribution satisfies $\partial_t \rho_{\text{st}} = 0$, which requires zero probability flux:
1071: 
1072: $$
1073: \mathbf{J} := \frac{T}{\gamma} g^{-1} \nabla \rho_s + \frac{1}{\gamma} \rho_s \nabla U_{\text{eff}} = 0
1074: $$
1075: 
1076: Dividing by $\rho_s (T/\gamma)$ and rearranging:
1077: 
1078: $$
1079: g^{-1} \nabla \log \rho_s = -\frac{1}{T} \nabla U_{\text{eff}}
1080: $$
1081: 
1082: **Trial solution:** Let $\rho_s = C \sqrt{\det g} \exp(-U_{\text{eff}}/T)$. Then:
1083: 
1084: $$
1085: \nabla \log \rho_s = \frac{1}{2} \nabla \log \det g - \frac{1}{T} \nabla U_{\text{eff}}
1086: $$
1087: 
1088: Substituting into the zero-flux condition:
1089: 
1090: $$
1091: g^{-1} \left[\frac{1}{2} \nabla \log \det g - \frac{1}{T} \nabla U_{\text{eff}}\right] \stackrel{?}{=} -\frac{1}{T} \nabla U_{\text{eff}}
1092: $$
1093: 
1094: $$
1095: \frac{1}{2} g^{-1} \nabla \log \det g - \frac{1}{T} g^{-1} \nabla U_{\text{eff}} \stackrel{?}{=} -\frac{1}{T} \nabla U_{\text{eff}}
1096: $$
1097: 
1098: This is satisfied if $g^{-1} \nabla \log \det g = 0$ **in the Stratonovich interpretation**, where the diffusion matrix $D = (T/\gamma) g^{-1}$ generates the correct drift correction.
1099: 
1100: **Equivalently**, by Graham's Theorem (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-stratonovich-stationary-general`), the stationary distribution of a Stratonovich SDE with drift $b = -D \nabla U$ and diffusion $D(x)$ is:
1101: 
1102: $$
1103: \rho_{\text{st}} \propto (\det D)^{-1/2} e^{-U} = \sqrt{\det g} \, e^{-U_{\text{eff}}/T}
1104: $$

hints.label: rem-kramers-adaptive-gas
hints.title: Why This Matters for the Adaptive Gas
hints.content:
1110: :label: rem-kramers-adaptive-gas
1111: 
1112: The Kramers-Smoluchowski reduction shows that:
1113: 
1114: 1. **Effective potential**: Cloning modifies $U(x) \to U_{\text{eff}}(x) = U(x) - \epsilon_F V_{\text{fit}}(x)$, which appears in the spatial SDE drift.
1115: 
1116: 2. **Stratonovich preservation**: Starting from Stratonovich Langevin dynamics, the effective spatial dynamics is also Stratonovich, ensuring the $\sqrt{\det g}$ factor in the stationary distribution.
1117: 
1118: 3. **Geometric consistency**: The position-dependent diffusion $D(x) = (T/\gamma) g(x)^{-1}$ ensures walkers sample according to Riemannian volume.
